intro: Lathrocasis, commonly known as the common lathyrus, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous, with compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. They are often found in temperate regions and can thrive in a variety of soil types. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. Lathrocasis plants are also known for their ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
